alert.note: Alert for Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 6:57PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Heavy rain and strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Kanawha and southwestern Roane Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 656 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms near Pinch, or 7 miles northeast of Charleston, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Sissonville, Pinch, Elkview and Coal Fork. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 17. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 97 and 98, between mile markers 102 and 105, between mile markers 107 and 109, and between mile markers 111 and 117. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
